Does anyone know if space plan to add boat parts and something like a hanger to build them in at the water near KSC.

And if this is in wrong Sub-forum then could a moderator please move it.
Seeing as this is Kerbal Space Program, and I'm not sure of the last time boats made a huge contribution to space exploration. I highly doubt it

May be there are mods for it.

Do you really want it? Water kills my FPS.
When does Kerbal Ship Simulator come out?

I mean for exploring places like laythe, eve and if/when resources get implemented if there is a resource under water you could go and mine it from your boat/ship.

Also a lot of people make warships out of stock parts and they look like the real ones.

Also if we go boat parts we wouldn't have to use so many parts so you would be able to go into the water if you use a low part ship.

Seeing as this is Kerbal Space Program, and I'm not sure of the last time boats made a huge contribution to space exploration. I highly doubt it

A fine gentlemen once said that any 'This isn't Kerbal X Program' counterargument won't work as long as we have plane parts, Spaceplane hangar and Runway. And boy do I agree with him.

We'll, ksp may refer to kerbal ship program. XD

A fine gentlemen once said that any 'This isn't Kerbal X Program' counterargument won't work as long as we have plane parts, Spaceplane hangar and Runway. And boy do I agree with him.

Spaceplane hangar. Boats can not go to space for any practical reason, and it would simply clutter up the parts menu.

Spaceplane hangar. Boats can not go to space for any practical reason, and it would simply clutter up the parts menu.

What about adding a completely different sub-section.

Spaceplane hangar. Boats can not go to space for any practical reason, and it would simply clutter up the parts menu.

You can still make airplanes which can't leave Kerbin.

And how do you haul airplanes to Laythe, huh? By strapping them on top of a rocket. Same with boats. They'd be a pratical way to explore Eve and Laythe. Mostly Laythe.

I'm not sure of the last time boats made a huge contribution to space exploration.

Well, there's the ships that acted as communications stations, there's the recovery fleets that picked up Mercury, Gemini, and Apollo capsule, there's the SRB recovery ships that retrieved the boosters from shuttle launches.

But I agree. I'm here for the space part. I've played enough boat simulators that I don't need this to be one as well.

And how do you haul airplanes to Laythe, huh?

SSTO's are already capable of spaceflight, give it enough fuel and it can get to Laythe,

What's in a name? Many arguments could be made against the inclusion of boats in KSP, physics limitations, scope of the game, actual gameplay use ect. Personally I don't really care if boats were added. I'm not campaigning for or against the issue. As far as I know there hasn't been any official word from Squad and no mention of it on the WNTS. That being said there are many good arguments against the inclusion of boats, because of the name of the game however is not one of those.

Regards

Dodgey

You can still make airplanes which can't leave Kerbin.

And how do you haul airplanes to Laythe, huh? By strapping them on top of a rocket. Same with boats. They'd be a pratical way to explore Eve and Laythe. Mostly Laythe.

Thanks for agreeing with me

This is a good idea, yes there are plenty of mods, and parts already float...

but to back this guy up, Ksp is based in some ways on real life (parts,physics etc) and there is a concept of sending submarine probes to europa (ksp laythe) so this is within the range of what might be made in future updates... but don't count on it til squad says so..
I really don't want the devs to be devoting time to developing, testing, and debugging boats, when they have bigger, tastier fish to fry in the spacecraft department.

SSTO's are already capable of spaceflight, give it enough fuel and it can get to Laythe,

True, but wheeled rovers aren't. Yet they are useful.

I don't imagine boats being essential for space travel- even rovers can sort of be replaced by hopping about with rocket engines- but they would be nice. And maybe we'll have a planet even more ocean than Laythe one day. The ability to economically move through water would be essential.

Boats probably wouldn't need many parts to work, but they aren't exactly something needed urgently.

Until then, I highly recommend this mod.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/ksf-boat-propeller/

You'll need to add

PART [

around the CFG content, but it seems to work for me.

I'm quite sure that Squad has denied adding boat parts. However, InfiniteDice and his team has made a mod that adds just that - boat parts, including carrier parts.

What about inflatable, hi-impact tolerance parts? they could/would be super buoyant and be used for boats and floating platforms too. could be used for a wide range of purposes. maybe even self righting system for rovers that get turned upside down.

they're used in real world too:

Edited February 13, 2014 by Capt Snuggler

I'm quite sure that Squad has denied adding boat parts. However, InfiniteDice and his team has made a mod that adds just that - boat parts, including carrier parts.

I have a hard time with this, why add a planet such as Laythe and not add any kind of boat parts? It makes more sense to have boats, especially carriers on Kerbin.

Anyways, I was browsing the forums yesterday when I found this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54907-Some-of-my-crafts-%28cars-sea-ships-realistic-train-war-machines-and-more%29-many-pics

KSP is about exploration. The fact it has 'space' in the title is no good reason to not have boats.

Planets have water, planets are in space. We explore those planets. Why make 75% of the planet inaccessible??

I am 100% sure water parts will come at some point.

MJ
